result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P Blaser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.
With Huber. Concur to sentence currently serving. Sentence deemed served.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 10/4/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

IN CUSTODY
1:35 PM Defendant Jonathan P Blaser in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Jonathan P Blaser.  Attorney Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 20 DAYS  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cc to sentence currently serving

-Days credit for time served:  28 days
-Days credit to jail: 28 days
-Deemed served

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other CC,  due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

 
-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights
